verses.text: 主在烈怒中，怎麼竟然使黑雲遮蓋錫安的居民（「居民」原文作「女子」）！他把以色列的榮美，從天上拋到地上；他在發怒的日子，竟不記念自己的腳凳。

words.note: Often refers to God's wrath in biblical texts.
Quoted text clarifying the original word.
Quoted text clarifying the original word.
Often refers to the dwelling place of God.
Short for 竟然.
Symbolic of a place of subservience or resting place.

verses.heading: \it א (\+w Alef|strong="H0136"\+w*\it*)

verses.text: 主吞滅了雅各所有住處，毫不顧惜；他在忿怒中，把猶大居民的堅固城拆毀；他使國家和國中眾領袖都倒在地上，受盡羞辱。

words.note: Idiomatic expression meaning 'without the slightest pity'.

verses.heading: ב (\it Bet\it*)

verses.text: 他在烈怒中砍斷以色列所有的角；他從仇敵面前，收回自己的右手。他像吞滅四周物件的火燄，在雅各中間焚燒。

words.note: Often refers to God's wrath in biblical texts.
Symbolic of strength, power, or honor.

verses.heading: ג (\it Gimel\it*)

verses.text: 他像仇敵拉弓，他的右手已經預備好。他像敵人把一切悅人眼目的都殺滅了；他如火的忿怒倒在錫安居民（「居民」原文作「女子」）的帳棚上。

words.note: Idiomatic expression meaning 'attractive'.
Quoted text clarifying the original word.
Quoted text clarifying the original word.

verses.heading: ד (\it Dalet\it*)

verses.text: 主好像成了仇敵；他吞滅了以色列和她所有的宮殿，毀壞了她的堅固城。他在猶大居民的中間，增添了悲哀和哭號。
verses.heading: ה (\it \+w He|strong="H3605"\+w*\it*)

verses.text: 他把自己的住所破壞，好像園子一樣；他毀壞了屬他的聚會之處。耶和華使節期和安息日都在錫安被忘記；他在他的盛怒中棄絕了君王和祭司。

words.note: Introduces direct object before verb.
Classical Chinese particle, often similar to '的'.

verses.heading: ו (\it Vav\it*)

verses.text: 主丟棄了自己的祭壇，厭棄了自己的聖所。他把宮殿的圍牆，交付在仇敵的手裡；他們在耶和華的殿中喧嚷，好像慶祝節日一樣。

words.note: Introduces direct object before verb.

verses.heading: ז (\it Zayin\it*)

verses.text: 耶和華定意要拆毀錫安居民（「居民」原文作「女子」）的城牆；他拉了準繩，決不停手，務要把它吞滅。他使堡壘和城牆都悲哀，一同受痛苦。

words.note: Introduces direct object before verb.

verses.heading: ח (\it Khet\it*)

verses.text: 錫安的眾城門已經陷入地裡；耶和華把錫安的門閂都毀壞折斷了。錫安的君王和領袖都身在列國中；錫安再沒有律法了；它的眾先知也得不到從耶和華而來的異象。

words.note: Indicates plural or multitude.
Introduces direct object before verb.
Indicates plural or multitude.

verses.heading: ט (\it Tet\it*)

verses.text: 錫安居民（「居民」原文作「女子」）的長老都坐在地上，默默無聲；他們把塵灰撒在頭上，腰束麻布。耶路撒冷的處女都垂頭至地。

words.note: Introduces direct object before verb.

verses.heading: י (\it Yod\it*)

verses.text: 我的眼睛因流淚而失明，我的心腸激動，我的肝膽傾倒在地，都因我的子民（「我的子民」原文作「我子民的女子」）遭毀滅，孩童和嬰兒在城裡的街上昏倒。

words.note: Lit. 'heart and intestines'; refers to inner feelings.
Metaphor for one's inner being or courage.
Often used for God's chosen people.

verses.heading: כ (\it Kaf\it*)

verses.text: 他們像被刺傷的人昏倒在城裡街上的時候，他們在母親的懷裡快要喪命的時候，他們就問母親：「五穀和酒在哪裡呢？」

words.note: Refers to staple grains.

verses.heading: ל (\it Lamed\it*)

verses.text: 耶路撒冷的居民哪，我怎樣向你說明呢？用甚麼與你比較呢？錫安的居民哪，我們用甚麼跟你相比，好安慰你呢？你的裂口像海那樣大，誰能醫治你呢？

words.note: Used to address someone or express surprise.
Metaphor for a severe wound or calamity.

verses.heading: מ (\it Mem\it*)

verses.text: 你的假先知為了你所見的異象，盡是虛謊和愚昧；他們沒有顯露你的罪孽，使你的命運得以挽回；他們為你所得的默示，全是虛謊，是引人走錯路的。

words.note: Forms a noun phrase like 'that which is V-ed'.
Implies a revelation received silently or implicitly from God.

verses.heading: נ (\it Nun\it*)

verses.text: 所有過路的人，都拍掌嘲笑你；他們嗤笑耶路撒冷的居民，並搖頭說：「被人稱為最完美，為全地所喜悅的，就是這城嗎？」

words.note: A more classical/formal passive marker than '被'.

verses.heading: ס (\it Samek\it*)

verses.text: 你所有的仇敵都張開口攻擊你，他們嗤笑你，又咬牙切齒，說：「我們吞滅它了！這真是我們期待的日子！我們等到了！親眼看見了！」

words.note: Indicates a passive or agentive construction.
An idiom meaning to show extreme hatred or anger.

verses.heading: פ (\it Pe\it*)

verses.text: 耶和華作成了他定意去作的，成就了他的話，就是他昔日所宣告的，他把你拆毀，並不憐惜，他使仇敵因勝過你而高興，他高舉你敵人的角。

words.note: Hebrew name for God, often translated as 'the LORD'.
Used to emphasize or clarify.
In biblical context, 'horn' often symbolizes strength or power.

verses.heading: ע (\it Ayin\it*)

verses.text: 錫安居民（「居民」原文作「女子」）的城牆啊，你要一心向主哀求；願你的眼淚像江河般湧流，晝夜不息；願你得不著歇息，願你眼中的瞳人不能休息。

words.note: Original text implies 'daughters of Zion'.
A negative potential complement construction.

verses.heading: \bd צ\bd* (\it Tsade\it*)

verses.text: 夜裡每到交更的時分，你要起來呼喊；在主面前你要傾心如水！你的孩童在各街頭上因飢餓而昏倒，你要為他們的性命向主舉手禱告。

words.note: Refers to the changing of guards or watches through the night.

verses.heading: ק (\it Qof\it*)

verses.text: 「耶和華啊，求你觀看！求你鑒察！你曾這樣對待過誰呢？難道婦人應該吃掉自己所生的，就是自己所撫養的嬰孩嗎？難道祭司和先知應該在主的聖所裡被殺害嗎？」
verses.heading: \it ר (\+w Resh|strong="H7200"\+w*\it*)

verses.text: 少年人和老年人都在街上倒臥在地死了；我的年輕男女都倒斃於刀下；在你忿怒的日子，你殺了他們，你屠殺了他們，毫不憐惜。

words.note: Literary term for lying down, often implying collapse or death.
Literary, often refers to violent or sudden death, especially in battle or disaster.
Classical Chinese preposition, often replaced by 在 (zài) or 被 (bèi) in modern Chinese.
Figurative for death by weapon.
Often refers to divine anger or righteous indignation in biblical contexts.
Refers to large-scale, brutal killing; often in historical or religious texts.
Emphasizes complete lack of something.
More formal or literary than '可憐' (kělián).

verses.heading: ש (\it Sin/Shin\it*)

verses.text: 你從四圍招聚驚嚇我的，好像招聚人過節的日子一樣。在耶和華忿怒的日子，沒有人可以逃脫，可以生存。我所撫育、所養大的，我的仇敵都滅盡了。

words.note: Refers to all directions or surroundings; somewhat literary.
Often used in biblical contexts for God gathering people or armies.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun phrase, e.g., 'those who frighten me'.
Often used in biblical contexts for God gathering people or armies.
Often refers to divine anger or righteous indignation in biblical contexts.
Used to form a nominalized verbal phrase, often with a passive sense.
Refers to careful upbringing or nourishment, often in a protective context.
Used to form a nominalized verbal phrase, often with a passive sense.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun phrase, e.g., 'those whom I raised'.
Often refers to adversaries in spiritual or national conflicts, prominent in scripture.
Strong term for total annihilation, often with divine judgment implication.

verses.heading: ת (\it Tav\it*)
